word: "RESOLVED, THAT WE EXPRESS OUR DEEP INTEREST IN THE TEMPERANCE MOVEMENT NOW GOING FORWARD IN THIS STATE; AND THAT WE INSTRUCT ALL OUR MINISTERS TO USE THEIR INFLUENCE AMONG OUR CHURCHES AND WITH THE PEOPLE AT LARGE TO INDUCE THEM TO PUT FORTH EVERY CONSISTENT EFFORT, BY PERSONAL LABOR, AND AT THE BALLOT BOX, IN FAVOR OF THE PROHIBITORY AMENDMENT OF THE CONSTITUTION, WHICH THE FRIENDS OF TEMPERANCE ARE SEEKING TO SECURE."--REVIEW AND HERALD, JULY 5, 1881.
